ppc_note_A: Only 1 recent (2019) apparent PPC example found during archive search: https://doi.org/10.1007/s40750-018-0106-3

CUADERNOS DE NEUROPSICOLOGIA-PANAMERICAN JOURNAL OF NEUROPSYCHOLOGY
ppc_description_A: Of characteristics and variable length according to criteria of the editorial body. Emphasis is placed on the discussion on the contents of the magazine or the reflective comment on events that occurred in the world regarding the theme of the magazine.
ppc_note_A: Full article type description "Letters and announcements of academic activities"
general_note: Unclear from article type description but benefit of the doubt being given. No PPC examples found during brief archive search.

Whilst "Commentary" is listed as an article type, does not appear to meet our PPC definition, confirmed via archive search. Journal appears to have previously accepted Letters to the Editor, some being published online as recent as 2020 but originally received prior to 2000.

journal: JOURNAL OF SPORT PSYCHOLOGY IN ACTION

general_note: UNCLEAR, scope includes statement "...to facilitate and stimulate informed academic dialogue and debate toward an integrative body of knowledge via both relevant and rigorous theory-building and theory-testing" but limited details given on article types and no PPC examples found during archive search.

ppc_description_A: "Dialogues/Debates over contemporary theoretical/practical/methodological issues." Represents one type of 'Alternate Format' that is accepted, could encompass PPC.
ppc_length_A: UNCLEAR (provide detail in the 'other' section below), 6000-7000 words maximum although shorter and longer submissions will be considered as appropriate to the aims of the article.
ppc_note_A: "recommended word counts include the main body of the paper, not title page, abstract, references, tables, figures, etc. The word counts are considered general guidelines for each type of paper rather than strictly enforced limits."

general_note: I have coded this as 'no PPC' because the website indicates that critical commentaries are solicited by the editor.

ppc_description_A: Commentaries, letters to the editors, book reviews, or position papers will be considered and are not subject to peer-review.
ppc_note_A:
No further details given on this article type.

NOTE: While "commentaries" are listed as accepted an archive search using term "comment" produced 3 commentaries, none of which were PPC. Appears to be more for discussing general topics. Therefore, decided not to include as an additional PPC type.

ppc_note_A:
"Reviews and Letters will be published at no charge "

No description of letters given, no examples found. Link to journal website for more info appears broken.

general_note: There is an accepted article type called 'Text review' which allows authors to "discuss, criticize or complement articles related to the subject of the monographic issue". I haven't interpreted this as PPC, as it doesn't seem to allow critical discourse of previously published articles. However, I might not have made the right call here.

ppc_review_A: UNCLEAR (provide detail in the 'other' section below), The website states: "All articles are subject to peer-review. Occasionally, invited Letters, Essays or Reviews may not be subject to external peer-review." This perhaps implies that non-invited letters ARE sent for external review.
ppc_note_A: There is no detail provided on the website about the kinds of manuscripts accepted for publication, only the names of the manuscript types. It may be that 'Commentaries' are another potential form of PPC, but with no detail provided I have just included this one PPC type of 'Letters to the Editors'.
